basics.name: Robert Swanson-Neitzel
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026.

work.summary: I troubleshoot and repair hardware and software, providing both in-person and over-the-phone customer support. I also manage the installation and maintenance of server infrastructure, PBX and VOIP systems, as well as printers, copiers, and scanners. Additionally, I create and update incident reports to ensure smooth operations.
At DTL Hawaii, I maintained and updated client websites on WordPress, using the 'Local' app for staging and the 'Avada' theme for development.
During my time at Olelo Community Media, I tested and modified programs and databases, enhancing performance and ensuring accuracy by maintaining relevant information.
For my second internship with Olelo Community Media, I researched key contacts, managed databases using Apptivo CRM, and assisted with account tracking to improve the Olelo Lokahi Project.
